content: Wow excellent topic and commentary! I agree a key issue is the in your face view of organizational dysfunction. But I think a huge issue Kanban gets blamed for is where to start with a complex system. Most people continue to make patterns out of the work and then categorize the patterns. This is natural and can be good until it turns into admiration of the problem and loses common understanding in the layers of complexity. The key is to fix one thing and see the impact, then another and another. Before long you see significant improvement. None of which could have occurred with the complex view. Visual complexity doesn’t mean complex solutions. This also goes to the worker empowerment — make small changes without permission.
